listitems.content: I Don't know what tools are being used when I build a website using react
I can build a project with create-react-app, and I've heard about webpack, but I don't know whats going between them

sections.title: The Hope
sections.subTitle: As a developer I'd like to...

listitems.content: ...be able to articulate the tolls that I'm using
...be able to give at least an overview of how these tools are working together
...have my own boilerplate project where I've compiled react/webpack/babel etc.
...understand and being able to assemble a frontend app using the tools of react, webpack, babel, npm, and node.

sections.title: The Practice
sections.subTitle: Here's a few one-liners to give an overview of the tooling

listitems.title: React
listitems.content: A lightweight JavaScript library used for building component-focused UIs (almost lifted directly from their website!). In a frontend build system, React builds the entire UI from an otherwise empty html document.

listitems.title: Webpack
listitems.content: An npm module used to 'compile' or 'bundle' javascript. In a frontend build system, webpack shrinks the size of the javascript that is delivered to the browser. Webpack dev server is also used as a server during the development process.

listitems.title: Babel
listitems.content: A module that transforms code when the syntax is not natively readable by a browser. Browsers don't know what to do with JSX.

listitems.title: NPM
listitems.content: NPM hosts a bunch of code (repositiories) that are writtend and 'packaged' up for folks like us to install and use.

listitems.title: Node
listitems.content: With the node runtime, JS can run on a server. Node is used here to develop an http server. Node is an underlying tech, and a frontend build system hardly writes any core node code.
